page.title: 01INTRODUCTION-CAMELS' AREA
page.content: The area of our study lies in a wide clay vale with a limestone ridge rising in the north. The River Cam runs at the foot of the ridge while the A303 runs along the top. The river has trees along it's banks many of which are in the process of being cleared. There are two villages, West Camel and Queen Camel where the older houses are built of local stone. The hamlet of Bridgehampton lies on the western border adjoining the airfield of R.N.A.S. Yeovilton. Farming is the main industry in our area. This is mainly cattle, but there are some sheep and there is both a large pig farm and a chicken farm. Very little land is planted for crops, but a few fields are planted with rape seed or wheat. In summer there is a great volume of traffic on its way to the S.W. coastal resorts.
